```{R, eval = F}
demand_function <- function(q) 10 - q
supply_function <- function(q) 1 + 1.5 * q

curve(expr = demand_function, from = 0, 10,
  xlab = "Q", ylab = "P", n = 100)
curve(expr = supply_function, from = 0, 10, add = T)
curve(expr = supply_function(x) + 3, from = 0, 10, add = T, col = "red")
```

```{r, engine = 'tikz'}
\documentclass{article}

\usepackage{pgfplots}

\begin{document}

\begin{tikzpicture}
\begin{axis}[
  axis lines = left,
  xlabel = $x$,
  ylabel = {$f(x)$},
  ]
%Below the red parabola is defined
\addplot [
  domain=-10:10,
  samples=100,
  color=red,
  ]
{x^2 - 2*x - 1};
\addlegendentry{$x^2 - 2x - 1$}
%Here the blue parabloa is defined
\addplot [
  domain=-10:10,
  samples=100,
  color=blue,
  ]
{x^2 + 2*x + 1};
\addlegendentry{$x^2 + 2x + 1$}

\end{axis}
\end{tikzpicture}

\end{document}
```
